sentences.sentence: The Big and the Little Fish
As a fisherman was pulling in his net( 网 ) from the sea, he noticed that it was full of all sorts of( 各种各样的 ) fish.
The little fish got away through the holes in the net( 网 ) and swam to safety,
while the big fish could not get away and were caught.
MORAL: Sometimes it’s good to be unimportant.
The Bird and Her Babies
A bird had made her nest( 巢穴 ) in a farmer’s field, and her babies were almost grown.
The owner of the field came and said, “I must ask all my neighbors to help me with my harvest( 收割 ).”
One of the young birds heard him, and asked his mother where they should move for safety.
“We don’t need to move yet, my son,” she replied.
The owner came a few days later, and said, “I will come by myself tomorrow, and start the harvest( 收割 ).”
Then the bird said to her young, “It is time to go.
His friends aren’t coming.
He will do the work himself.”
MORAL: If you need something done properly, do it yourself.
The Blind Man and the Baby Wolf( 狼 )
A blind man could tell different animals by touching them with his hands.
A baby wolf( 狼 ) was brought to him, and he touched it to guess what it was.
He said, “I don’t know whether it is a baby fox( 狐狸 ) or a baby wolf( 狼 ).
But I know the sheep wouldn’t be safe with it around!”
MORAL: Evil( 罪恶的 ) signs are shown early in life.
The Boasting( 吹嘘 ) Traveler
A man who had travelled in foreign lands boasted of( 吹嘘 ) the many wonderful and heroic things he had done in the different places he had visited.
He said that when he was in Rhodes, he had jumped so far that no man at that time could jump nearly as far.
He also said that many people saw him do it, and he could call them as witnesses( 目击者 ).
One of the listeners said, “Now, if this be all true, there is no need for witnesses( 目击者 ).
Let’s pretend( 假装 ) this is Rhodes—now do your jump!”
MORAL: Stop a boaster( 吹牛的人 ) by putting his words to the test( 检验 ).
The Boy and the Nettle( 荨麻 )
A boy was stung( 刺 ) by a nettle( 荨麻 ).
He ran home and told his mother,
“I only touched it gently, but it hurt me so much.”
“That was just what caused it to sting( 刺 ) you.” said his mother,
“The next time you touch a nettle( 荨麻 ), grab( 抓住 ) it tightly( 紧紧地 ), and it will be as soft as silk to your hand, and will not hurt you.”
MORAL: Whatever you do, do with all your strength.
The Boy and the Nuts( 坚果 )
A boy put his hand into a jar( 罐子 ) full of nuts( 坚果 ).
He grabbed( 抓住 ) as many as he could, but when he tried to pull out his hand,
he couldn’t, because the neck of the jar( 罐子 ) wasn’t wide enough.
Not wanting to lose his nuts( 坚果 ), and yet unable to take out his hand,
he felt disappointed and started to cry.
Someone said to him, “Be satisfied with( 满意 ) half the amount, and you will easily pull out your hand.”
MORAL: Do not attempt too much at once.

article_info.previous: 在昨天的故事里，蝗虫夏天贪玩，天天唱歌，到了冬天没有粮食吃，饿了肚子，这个故事告诉我们人要有远见，为未来做准备。
article_info.share_words: If you need something done properly, do it yourself. Stop a boaster by putting his words to the test.

question.cn: 在故事The Big and the Little Fish中，小鱼怎么从渔网中逃脱的？
question.en: In the story the Big and the Little Fish, how did the little fish escape from the net?

options.cn: 他们穿过渔网中的洞逃离。
options.en: They fit through the holes in the net.
The big fish helped them get away.

analysis: 文中提到:“The little fish got away through the holes in the net and swam to safety.”由此可知，小鱼从网的空隙中跑走了，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Bird and Her babies中，谁帮助农场主收获庄稼？
question.en: In the story the Bird and Her babies, who helped the owner harvest the crops?

analysis: 文中提到：“ I will come by myself tomorrow, and start the harvest.”由此可知，农场主的朋友并没有来，农场主自己收获庄稼，因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事The Boy and the Nettle中，小男孩受伤的原因？
question.en: In the story the Boy and the Nettle, why did the boy get hurt?

options.cn: 小男孩轻轻地触碰了荨麻。
options.en: The boy touched the nettles gently.

options.cn: 小男孩紧紧地握住了荨麻。
options.en: The boy grabbed the nettles tightly.
The boy fell onto the nettles.

analysis: 文中提到：“His mother said ‘that was just what caused it to sting you.’”和“I only touched it gently.”由此可知，答案选A。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第3天
